<target_code>
Here is the code of call_connection_handler:
```c
static void
call_connection_handler (struct MHD_Connection *connection)
{
  struct MHD_Daemon *daemon = connection->daemon;
  size_t processed;

  if (NULL != connection->rp.response)
    return;                     /* already queued a response */
  processed = 0;
  connection->rq.client_aware = true;
  connection->in_access_handler = true;
  if (MHD_NO ==
      daemon->default_handler (daemon->default_handler_cls,
                               connection,
                               connection->rq.url,
                               connection->rq.method,
                               connection->rq.version,
                               NULL,
                               &processed,
                               &connection->rq.client_context))
  {
    connection->in_access_handler = false;
    /* serious internal error, close connection */
    CONNECTION_CLOSE_ERROR (connection,
                            _ ("Application reported internal error, " \
                               "closing connection."));
    return;
  }
  connection->in_access_handler = false;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
suspicious_frags:

                               connection,
                               connection->rq.url,
                               connection->rq.method,
                               connection->rq.version,
                               NULL,
                               &processed,
                               &connection->rq.client_context)
explanation: Other fragments in this function are simple declarations, assignments or an early return and do not involve calling functions (directly or via macros/pointers), so they cannot by themselves create direct or indirect recursion. Examples: the local declarations (struct MHD_Daemon *daemon, size_t processed), the check and early return (if (NULL != connection->rp.response) return;), processed = 0;, and connection->rq.client_aware = true; are non-call operations. The items listed above are the only places in this function that may trigger code execution elsewhere (a function pointer call or a macro that may expand to calls) and therefore must be investigated for possible direct or indirect calls back into call_connection_handler.
